channel.title: Homelab on Software Engineering & DevOps - Matt Britt
channel.description: Recent content in Homelab on Software Engineering & DevOps - Matt Britt

item.title: Exposing our application to the internet
item.description: The linkding app is now running on our cluster, but in order to make it useful it would be good to expose it to the internet.

item.title: Adding storage to our homelab application
item.description: In order to persist any data that will be generated be linkding, we need to make sure that we have persistent storage.

item.title: Installing our first homelab application with GitOps
item.description: After setting up Flux on the cluster, its time to put it to use! I’ll be deploying an app called Linkding, which is a bookmark manager.

item.title: GitOps with Flux
item.description: Today I installed Flux onto the cluster in order to implement GitOps for my homelab.

item.title: Homelab high availability K3S cluster install
item.description: I’ve completed the install of a high availability K3S cluster onto the 5 Optiplex machines. Had one or two issues, that meant I had to reinstall with a new secret, but otherwise was pretty smooth!

item.title: Homelab kickoff - host provisioning
item.description: To start the homelab I’ve completed the installation of Ubuntu Server onto the 5 Dell Optiplex mini-pcs that will be running my Kubernetes homelab.
